docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
Last updated: 2025-08-20 11:05Z (version v6)

The Sarah and Patrick Wills Foundation is a small family foundation supporting projects in ecology, education, and social good.

We focus on organisations where our support can make a clear and lasting difference.

Learn more about the charities we support

docs.title: About Us
docs.text:
The Sarah and Patrick Wills Foundation is a private charitable foundation registered as Charity 1196516 since 8th April 2021.

We are a family-led initiative that supports a small number of high-impact charitable projects through a trustee-led network. We focus on ecology, education, and social good, guided by a commitment to ethical governance and long-term relationships.

The Foundation ensures transparency in its funding decisions and provides feedback to the initiatives supported.

docs.title: Charities We Support
docs.text: We support initiatives in ecology, education, and social good. All donations are made at the discretion of our trustees. We do not accept unsolicited requests for funding. Here are the most recent ones:

docs.title: Whitley Fund for Nature
docs.text: Supporting grassroots conservation leaders across the Global South to protect biodiversity and strengthen local communities. Learn more →

docs.title: Borneo Regrow
docs.text: Restoring Borneo’s damaged rainforest ecosystems through science-led reforestation and community partnerships. (Ceased operating 2025; original website now offline.)

docs.title: Art for Cure
docs.text: Raising funds for breast cancer research and care through inspirational art exhibitions and events. Learn more →

docs.title: Key4Life
docs.text:
Rehabilitating young men at risk of offending or reoffending through innovative programmes that build emotional resilience, employability skills, and positive futures. Learn more →

We build long-term relationships with the organisations we support, focusing on thoughtful, sustained commitment rather than one-off grants.

docs.title: Contact
docs.text:
